conclusion: Transparent body ABDE with right-angled trapezoid cross section and refractive index n = sqrt(2). Point O is at the corner where angle EOA = 45Â°.
Need to find the time for light to travel from O to the AB boundary.
Light travels at speed c in vacuum.
In a medium with refractive index n, light travels at speed v = c/n.
Assume light travels in a straight line from O to the AB boundary.
Set up a coordinate system with O at the origin (0,0). Place A at position (0,a) where a > 0, and B is somewhere to the right of A on the AB line.
Calculate the speed of light in the medium: v = c/sqrt(2) = c * sqrt(2)/2.
Calculate time: Time = Distance/Speed = a/(c * sqrt(2)/2) = 2a/(c * sqrt(2)) = sqrt(2) * a/c.
Express the answer in terms of distance OA: t = sqrt(2) * OA/c.
If OA is denoted as d, then t = sqrt(2) * d/c.
Note: If specific dimensions for the trapezoid are included, the answer would need adjustment.
